update.description:
Highlight selected entities on the world and the menu.

Some examples using Ogre 1 and 2:

![highlight_1.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2725716442-highlight_1.gif)
![highlight_2.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2872878114-highlight_2.gif)
![highlight_3.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/1850624746-highlight_3.gif)

This adds the `GuiEvents.hh` header like pull request #493.

Unfortunately, the Gazebo-classic-style bounding box can't be added to Blueprint or Citadel, because it would break Ignition Rendering's ABI. So this method using the emissive light is just a filler to provide the user some feedback on the older versions. I'm open to other non-ABI-breaking suggestions.
update.title: Highlight selected entities

content.raw: The highlight calls were being made from outside the render thread, and this could be causing this issue. I moved highlighting to the render thread in a828c5e. I can't reproduce the crash now, but I need to test more.
content.html: The highlight calls were being made from outside the render thread, and this could be causing this issue. I moved highlighting to the render thread in a828c5e. I can't reproduce the crash now, but I need to test more.

content.raw: LGTM!  I’ll second my currently existing approval.  I do have suspicions that the Ogre seg faults that we currently have an issue open \(I couldn’t find it now when I looked but I’ll look again shortly\) for are attributed to this PR - I was working a lot on branches w/o selection the past few days and instantly got those same `hlm_directional_light` crashes upon selecting and deselecting.  Other than that, selection worked and stayed consistent.

content.raw:
Since we don't have a good way to write automated GUI tests yet, I'll write down the manual test cases I'm going through:

* Clicking a model in 3D view highlights it on 3D and on the tree
    * :white_check_mark:
* Clicking an entity on the tree highlights it on the tree, and also on 3D if it's a model, link or visual
    * :white_check_mark:
* Clicking on the ground plane or sky on 3D deselects all entities
    * :white_check_mark:
* Hitting escape deselects all entities
    * :white_check_mark:
* Clicking a model in 3D while there's another entity already selected while holding `Ctrl` selects that model as well
    * :white_check_mark:
* Clicking an entity in the tree while there's another entity already selected while holding `Ctrl` selects that entity as well
    * :white_check_mark:
* Selecting a model then choosing translate mode attaches the tool to the selected model
    * :white_check_mark: 
* Selecting translate mode and then selecting a model attaches the tool to the selected model
    * :white_check_mark: 
* Selecting a non-model then choosing translate mode should not attach the tool to the selected entity, even if it has a visual representation
    * :white_check_mark: 
* Selecting translate mode and then selecting a non-model should not attach the tool to the selected entity
    * :white_check_mark: 
* Multi-selecting models then choosing translate mode should attach tool to last selected model and leave only that selected
    * :white_check_mark: 
* Choosing translate mode then selecting multiple models should attach tool to last selected model and leave only that selected
    * :white_check_mark: 
* Select a model, then orbit the camera - the model should stay selected
    * :white_check_mark: 
* Select a model, then orbit the camera, releasing the mouse on top of another model - the other model should not be selected
    * :white_check_mark:
content.html:
Since we don't have a good way to write automated GUI tests yet, I'll write down the manual test cases I'm going through:

  • Clicking a model in 3D view highlights it on 3D and on the tree
  • Clicking an entity on the tree highlights it on the tree, and also on 3D if it's a model, link or visual
  • Clicking on the ground plane or sky on 3D deselects all entities
  • Hitting escape deselects all entities
  • Clicking a model in 3D while there's another entity already selected while holding Ctrl selects that model as well
  • Clicking an entity in the tree while there's another entity already selected while holding Ctrl selects that entity as well
  • Selecting a model then choosing translate mode attaches the tool to the selected model
  • Selecting translate mode and then selecting a model attaches the tool to the selected model
  • Selecting a non-model then choosing translate mode should not attach the tool to the selected entity, even if it has a visual representation
  • Selecting translate mode and then selecting a non-model should not attach the tool to the selected entity
  • Multi-selecting models then choosing translate mode should attach tool to last selected model and leave only that selected
  • Choosing translate mode then selecting multiple models should attach tool to last selected model and leave only that selected
  • Select a model, then orbit the camera - the model should stay selected
  • Select a model, then orbit the camera, releasing the mouse on top of another model - the other model should not be selected

content.raw:
The 1st point was addressed on 14d2b51.

The trick is to remember to always check the global `QGuiApplication::keyboardModifiers()` instead of the mouse event's modifiers, unless we are explicitly interested in the modifiers from the moment the mouse was pressed.
content.html:
The 1st point was addressed on 14d2b51.

The trick is to remember to always check the global QGuiApplication::keyboardModifiers() instead of the mouse event's modifiers, unless we are explicitly interested in the modifiers from the moment the mouse was pressed.

content.raw:
The 2nd point has been addressed on 3530083.

tl;dr the compromise I came to was disabling selection when clicking on the whitespace before the item. Given the limitations of `TreeView`, we may want to create our own custom `IgnTreeView` in the future.
content.html:
The 2nd point has been addressed on 3530083.

tl;dr the compromise I came to was disabling selection when clicking on the whitespace before the item. Given the limitations of TreeView, we may want to create our own custom IgnTreeView in the future.

update.title: [WIP] Highlight selected entity

content.raw:
Thanks! I'll leave a note here on how to reproduce the 2 remaining issues:

### Ctrl focus

1. `ign gazebo shapes.sdf`
1. Click on box on 3D window
1. Click on white area below entity tree
1. Press `Ctrl`
1. Click on `cylinder` on the entity tree: :warning: The box gets deselected

### Selection by clicking on whitespace

1. `ign gazebo shapes.sdf`
1. Expand `box` and then `box_link` on the entity tree
1. Click on the white space in front of `box_visual` : :warning: the box visual is highlighted on the tree, but not selected on 3D
1. Click on the white space in front of `box_collision`: :warning: now both the visual and collision are highlighted on the tree, and not selected on 3D

I spent some time looking into the 2nd. That area is under the `rowDelegate`, and all the attempts I made at adding a `MouseArea` there to capture clicks broke the collapsible behaviour of the tree. So I'm trying to think of an alternative solution.
content.html:
Thanks! I'll leave a note here on how to reproduce the 2 remaining issues:

Ctrl focus

  1. ign gazebo shapes.sdf
  2. Click on box on 3D window
  3. Click on white area below entity tree
  4. Press Ctrl
  5. Click on cylinder on the entity tree: The box gets deselected

Selection by clicking on whitespace

  1. ign gazebo shapes.sdf
  2. Expand box and then box_link on the entity tree
  3. Click on the white space in front of box_visual : the box visual is highlighted on the tree, but not selected on 3D
  4. Click on the white space in front of box_collision: now both the visual and collision are highlighted on the tree, and not selected on 3D

I spent some time looking into the 2nd. That area is under the rowDelegate, and all the attempts I made at adding a MouseArea there to capture clicks broke the collapsible behaviour of the tree. So I'm trying to think of an alternative solution.
